titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Rice University Office of News and Media Relations videos, 1990-2008 UA 214
titlestmt.author: Andy Damico

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-02 12:45:44 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: Rice University Office of News and Media Relations videos collection
did.abstract: The Rice University Office of News and Media Relations keeps the media and the institution's community informed about the latest campus developments. They research, develop and share press releases and record special events on video or audio. That charge led to this collection that consists mostly of VHS tapes which contain news broadcasts and raw footage covering Rice University events or featuring speakers representing Rice University on many topics.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: As the university's primary outlet for official statements and information, Rice University Office of News and Media Relations keeps the media and the institution's community informed about the latest campus developments. They research, develop and share press releases and record special events on video or audio.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection consists mostly of VHS tapes which contain news broadcasts and raw footage covering Rice University events or featuring speakers representing Rice University on various topics. Highlights include snipets on Nanotechnology and Nanotubes, The 2003 College World Series Championship, Terrorism, and International Affairs. Featured speakers include Amb. Edward P. Djerejian, James A. Baker III, Prof. Richard E. Smalley, Prof. Ric Stoll, Assoc. Professor Dan Wallach and Amy M. Jaffe, Associate Director of the Rice Energy Program. The collection also includes 20 VHS tapes of talks given at the James A. Baker III Institute for Public Policy, 2000-2006.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored off-site at the Library Service Center. Please request this material via woodson@rice.edu or call 713-348-2586.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to the Woodson Research Center in 2009.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This material is arranged in chronological order.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: All tapes are VHS videotape format except where noted at the end of Box 1.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Rice University Office of News and Media Relations videos, 1990-2008, UA 214, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from this material must be obtained via the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University.
